009
010package imagingbook.common.sift;
011
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.Collections;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
018import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * Instances of this class perform matching between SIFT features. See Secs.
023 * 25.5 of [1] for more details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
027 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/11/20 removed inner Parameters class, changed constructor
032 */
033public class SiftMatcher {
034        
035        public static final NormType DefaultNormType = NormType.L2;
036        public static final double DefaultRMax = 0.8;
037        
038        private final VectorNorm norm;
039        private final double rMax;
040
041        /**
042         * Constructor using specific parameters.
043         * 
044         * @param normType the distance norm for comparing feature vectors
045         * @param rMax the max. distance ratio between best and second-best match
046         */
047        public SiftMatcher(NormType normType, double rMax) {
048                this.norm = normType.getInstance();
049                this.rMax = rMax;
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Constructor using default parameters.
054         * @see #DefaultNormType
055         * @see #DefaultRMax
056         */
057        public SiftMatcher() {
058                this(DefaultNormType, DefaultRMax);
059        }
060        
061        /**
062         * Finds matches between two sets of SIFT descriptors. For each descriptor in
063         * the first set, the best and second-best fits are searched for in the second
064         * set. A valid match instance is created if the distance to the best-matching
065         * descriptor is significantly smaller than the distance to the second-best
066         * matching descriptor. The resulting list of matches is sorted by increasing
067         * match distance.
068         * 
069         * @param setA the first set of SIFT descriptors
070         * @param setB the second set of SIFT descriptors
071         * @return a (possibly empty) list of {@link SiftMatch} instances
072         */
073        public List<SiftMatch> match(Collection<SiftDescriptor> setA, Collection<SiftDescriptor> setB) {
074                List<SiftMatch> matches = new ArrayList<SiftMatch>(setA.size());
075                                
076                for (SiftDescriptor si : setA) {
077                        SiftDescriptor s1 = null;                               // best-matching feature
078                        double d1 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;   // best match distance
079                        double d2 = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;   // second-best match distance
080                        
081                        for (SiftDescriptor sj : setB) {
082                                double d = si.getDistance(sj, norm); // dist(si, sj);
083                                if (d < d1) {   // new best match
084                                        d2 = d1;        // demote current best match to second-best (keep distance only)
085                                        s1 = sj;        // new best matching feature
086                                        d1 = d;         // new best match distance
087                                }
088                                else // not a new absolute min., but possible second-best
089                                        if (d < d2) { // new second-best distance
090                                                d2 = d;
091                                        }
092                        }
093                        if (Double.isFinite(d2) && d2 > 0.001 && d1/d2 < this.rMax) {
094                                SiftMatch m = new SiftMatch(si, s1, d1);
095                                matches.add(m);
096                        }
097                }
098
099                Collections.sort(matches);  // sort matches by ascending descriptor distance
100                return matches;
101        }
102
103}
